left.name: program_id
left.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

right.name: program_id
right.description: Unique identifier of the ARGO program.

meta.notes: This is the unique id that is assigned to your program.  If you have logged into the platform, this is the Program Id that you see in the Submission area. For example, PACA-CA is a Program ID.

notes.data: This is the unique id that is assigned to your program.  If you have logged into the platform, this is the Program Id that you see in the Submission area. For example, PACA-CA is a Program ID.

left.name: specimen_type

codeList: Normal - tissue adjacent to primary tumour

Cell line - derived from xenograft tumour

left.name: pathological_tumour_staging_system
left.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected. Pathological classification is based on the clinical stage information (acquired before treatment) and supplemented/modified by operative findings and pathological evaluation of the resected specimen.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

right.name: pathological_tumour_staging_system
right.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected. Pathological classification is based on the clinical stage information (acquired before treatment) and supplemented/modified by operative findings and pathological evaluation of the resected specimen.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

left.name: pathological_t_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the size or contiguous extension of the primary tumour (T), according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected pathological_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

right.name: pathological_t_category
right.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by the size or contiguous extension of the primary tumour (T), according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected pathological_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

left.name: pathological_n_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by whether or not the cancer has reached nearby lymph nodes (N), according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected pathological_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

right.name: pathological_n_category
right.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by whether or not the cancer has reached nearby lymph nodes (N), according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected pathological_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

left.name: pathological_m_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by whether there are distant metastases (M), meaning spread of cancer to other parts of the body, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected pathological_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

right.name: pathological_m_category
right.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by whether there are distant metastases (M), meaning spread of cancer to other parts of the body, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected pathological_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

left.name: pathological_stage_group
left.description: Specify the tumour stage, based on tumor_staging_system, used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected.

meta.notes: This field depends on the selected pathological staging system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

right.name: pathological_stage_group
right.description: Specify the tumour stage, based on tumour_staging_system, used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected.

meta.notes: This field depends on the selected pathological staging system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

description.data: Specify the tumour stage, based on tumour_staging_system, used to assess the cancer at the time the tumour specimen was resected.

left.name: specimen_acquisition_interval
left.description: Interval between primary diagnosis and specimen acquisition, in days.

right.name: specimen_acquisition_interval
right.description: Interval between primary diagnosis and specimen acquisition, in days.

meta.notes: The associated Primary Diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

notes.data: The associated Primary Diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

left.name: tumour_histological_type
left.description: The code to represent the histology (morphology) of neoplasms that is usually obtained from a pathology report, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3). Please refer to the guidelines provided in the ICD-O-3 manual at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

right.name: tumour_histological_type
right.description: The code to represent the histology (morphology) of neoplasms that is usually obtained from a pathology report, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3). Refer to the ICD-O-3 manual for guidelines at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

description.data: The code to represent the histology (morphology) of neoplasms that is usually obtained from a pathology report, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3). Refer to the ICD-O-3 manual for guidelines at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.

left.description: Anatomic location of a specimen when it was collected.

right.name: specimen_anatomic_location
right.description: Indicate the ICD-O-3 topography code for the anatomic location of a specimen when it was collected. Refer to the guidelines provided in the ICD-O-3 manual at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.

description.data: Indicate the ICD-O-3 topography code for the anatomic location of a specimen when it was collected. Refer to the guidelines provided in the ICD-O-3 manual at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.

left.name: specimen_storage
left.description: Indicate the method of specimen storage for specimens that were not extracted freshly or immediately cultured.

meta.notes: For specimens that were freshly extracted or immediately cultured, select Not Applicable.

left.name: central_pathology_confirmed
left.description: Indicate whether the histologic description of tissue or cells was confirmed by a pathology review of frozen or formalin fixed slide(s) completed after the diagnostic pathology review of the tumour sample used to extract analyte(s).

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

data.name: central_pathology_confirmed
data.description: Indicate whether the histologic description of tissue or cells was confirmed by a pathology review of frozen or formalin fixed slide(s) completed after the diagnostic pathology review of the tumour sample used to extract analyte(s).

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

left.name: tumour_grading_system
left.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the description of a tumour based on how abnormal the tumour cells and the tumour tissue look under a microscope. Tumour grade is an indicator of how quickly a tumour is likely to grow.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

right.name: tumour_grading_system
right.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to assess the description of a tumour based on how abnormal the tumour cells and the tumour tissue look under a microscope. Tumour grade is an indicator of how quickly a tumour is likely to grow.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

codeList: WHO grading system for CNS tumours

added: WHO grading system for CNS tumours

left.name: tumour_grade
left.description: Grade of the tumour as assigned by the reporting tumour_grading_system.

meta.notes: This field depends on the selected tumour grading system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

right.name: tumour_grade
right.description: Grade of the tumour as assigned by the reporting tumour_grading_system.

meta.notes: This field depends on the selected tumour grading system, and is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

left.name: percent_tumour_cells
left.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of infiltration by tumour cells in a specimen.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

right.name: percent_tumour_cells
right.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of infiltration by tumour cells in a specimen.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

left.name: percent_proliferating_cells
left.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the count of proliferating cells determined during pathologic review of the specimen.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

right.name: percent_proliferating_cells
right.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the count of proliferating cells determined during pathologic review of the specimen.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

left.name: percent_inflammatory_tissue
left.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents local response to cellular injury, marked by capillary dilatation, edema and leukocyte infiltration; clinically, inflammation is manifest by redness, heat, pain, swelling and loss of function, with the need to heal damaged tissue.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

right.name: percent_inflammatory_tissue
right.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents local response to cellular injury, marked by capillary dilatation, edema and leukocyte infiltration; clinically, inflammation is manifest by redness, heat, pain, swelling and loss of function, with the need to heal damaged tissue.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

left.name: percent_stromal_cells
left.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of reactive cells that are present in a malignant tumour specimen but are not malignant such as fibroblasts, vascular structures, etc.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

right.name: percent_stromal_cells
right.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of reactive cells that are present in a malignant tumour specimen but are not malignant such as fibroblasts, vascular structures, etc.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

left.name: percent_necrosis
left.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of cell death in a malignant tumour specimen.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

right.name: percent_necrosis
right.description: Indicate a value, in decimals, that represents the percentage of cell death in a malignant tumour specimen.

meta.notes: This field is only required if the specimen is a tumour.

left.name: basis_of_diagnosis
left.description: Indicate the most valid basis of how the primary diagnosis was identified. If more than one diagnosis technique was used, select the term that has the highest code number (see notes). (Reference: IACR Standard for Basis of Diagnosis http://www.iacr.com.fr/images/doc/basis.pdf)

meta.notes:
0: Death certificate only: Information provided is from a death certificate.
1: Clinical: Diagnosis made before death.
2: Clinical investigation: All diagnostic techniques, including X-ray, endoscopy, imaging, ultrasound, exploratory surgery (such as laparotomy), and autopsy, without a tissue diagnosis.
4: Specific tumour markers: Including biochemical and/or immunologic markers that are specific for a tumour site.
5: Cytology: Examination of cells from a primary or secondary site, including fluids aspirated by endoscopy or needle; also includes the microscopic examination of peripheral blood and bone marrow aspirates.
6: Histology of a metastasis: Histologic examination of tissue from a metastasis, including autopsy specimens.
7: Histology of a primary tumour: Histologic examination of tissue from primary tumour, however obtained, including all cutting techniques and bone marrow biopsies; also includes autopsy specimens of primary tumour.
9: Unknown: No information on how the diagnosis has been made.

right.name: basis_of_diagnosis
right.description: Indicate the most valid basis of how the primary diagnosis was identified. If more than one diagnosis technique was used, select the term that has the highest code number (see notes). (Reference: IACR Standard for Basis of Diagnosis http://www.iacr.com.fr/images/doc/basis.pdf)

meta.notes:
0: Death certificate only: Information provided is from a death certificate.
1: Clinical: Diagnosis made before death.
2: Clinical investigation: All diagnostic techniques, including X-ray, endoscopy, imaging, ultrasound, exploratory surgery (such as laparotomy), and autopsy, without a tissue diagnosis.
4: Specific tumour markers: Including biochemical and/or immunologic markers that are specific for a tumour site.
5: Cytology: Examination of cells from a primary or secondary site, including fluids aspirated by endoscopy or needle; also includes the microscopic examination of peripheral blood and bone marrow aspirates.
6: Histology of a metastasis: Histologic examination of tissue from a metastasis, including autopsy specimens.
7: Histology of a primary tumour: Histologic examination of tissue from primary tumour, however obtained, including all cutting techniques and bone marrow biopsies; also includes autopsy specimens of primary tumour.
9: Unknown: No information on how the diagnosis has been made.

left.name: clinical_tumour_staging_system
left.description: Indicate the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer at the time of primary diagnosis (prior to treatment).

right.name: clinical_tumour_staging_system
right.description: Indicate the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer at the time of primary diagnosis (prior to treatment).

left.name: clinical_stage_group
left.description: Stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.).

right.name: clinical_stage_group
right.description: Stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.).

meta.notes: This field is dependent on the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system

notes.data: This field is dependent on the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system

left.name: stage_suffix
left.description: If necessary, use this field to add any applicable stage suffixes. Stage suffixes may apply to certain staging systems such as Ann Arbour staging system where the four stages are divided into 4 categories (A, B, X and E).

data.name: stage_suffix
data.description: If necessary, use this field to add any applicable stage suffixes. Stage suffixes may apply to certain staging systems such as Ann Arbour staging system where the four stages are divided into 4 categories (A, B, X and E).

left.name: clinical_t_category
left.description: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

right.name: clinical_t_category
right.description: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

left.name: clinical_n_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by which is the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

right.name: clinical_n_category
right.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by which is the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

left.name: clinical_m_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined bythe extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual. MX is NOT a valid category and cannot be assigned.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

right.name: clinical_m_category
right.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined bythe extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined at time of primary diagnosis and prior to treatment, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual. MX is NOT a valid category and cannot be assigned.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected clinical_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

left.name: presenting_symptoms
left.description: Indicate presenting symptoms at time of primary diagnosis.

right.name: presenting_symptoms
right.description: Indicate presenting symptoms at time of primary diagnosis.

meta.notes: To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

data.notes: To include multiple values, separate values with a pipe delimiter '|' within your file.

left.name: performance_status
left.description: Indicate the donor's performance status grade at the time of primary diagnosis. (Reference source: ECOG performance score grades from https://ecog-acrin.org/resources/ecog-performance-status).

meta.notes:
Grade 0: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction 
 Grade 1: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature (ie. Light house work, office work) 
 Grade 2: Ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to carry out any work activities; up and about more than 50% of waking hours 
 Grade 3: Capable of only limited selfcare; confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours 
 Grade 4: Completely disabled; cannot carry on any selfcare; totally confined to bed or chair

right.name: performance_status
right.description: Indicate the donor's performance status grade at the time of primary diagnosis. (Reference source: ECOG performance score grades from https://ecog-acrin.org/resources/ecog-performance-status).

meta.notes:
Grade 0: Fully active, able to carry on all pre-disease performance without restriction 
 Grade 1: Restricted in physically strenuous activity but ambulatory and able to carry out work of a light or sedentary nature (ie. Light house work, office work) 
 Grade 2: Ambulatory and capable of all selfcare but unable to carry out any work activities; up and about more than 50% of waking hours 
 Grade 3: Capable of only limited selfcare; confined to bed or chair more than 50% of waking hours 
 Grade 4: Completely disabled; cannot carry on any selfcare; totally confined to bed or chair

left.name: treatment_start_interval
left.description: The interval between primary diagnosis and initiation of treatment, in days.

right.name: treatment_start_interval

meta.notes: The associated primary diagnosis is used as the reference point for this interval. To calculate this, find the number of days since the date of primary diagnosis.

left.description: Indicate the donor's disease status at time of follow-up.

left.description: Indicate the donor's relapse type.

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates progression or relapse.

right.description: Indicate the donor's relapse type.
right.name: relapse_type

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

notes.data: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

left.description: If the donor was clinically disease free following primary treatment and then relapse or progression (for liquid tumours) occurred afterwards, then this field will indicate the length of disease free interval, in days.
left.name: relapse_interval

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates progression or relapse.

right.description: If the donor was clinically disease free following primary treatment and then relapse or recurrence or progression (for liquid tumours) occurred afterwards, then this field will indicate the length of disease free interval, in days.
right.name: relapse_interval

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

description.data: If the donor was clinically disease free following primary treatment and then relapse or recurrence or progression (for liquid tumours) occurred afterwards, then this field will indicate the length of disease free interval, in days.

notes.data: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

left.description: Indicate the anatomic site where disease progression or recurrence occurred. (Codelist reference: NCI CDE ID: 4742851)

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates progression or relapse.

right.description: Indicate the ICD-O-3 topography code for the anatomic site where disease progression or recurrence occurred, according to the International Classification of Diseases for Oncology, 3rd Edition (WHO ICD-O-3). Refer to the ICD-O-3 manual for guidelines at https://apps.who.int/iris/handle/10665/42344.

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

notes.data: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

left.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer at time of retreatment for recurrence or disease progression. This may be represented as rTNM in the medical report.
left.name: recurrence_tumour_staging_system

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates progression or relapse.

right.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer at time of retreatment for recurrence or disease progression. This may be represented as rTNM in the medical report.

meta.notes: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

notes.data: This field is required to be submitted if disease_status_at_followup indicates a state of progression, relapse, or recurrence.

left.name: recurrence_t_category
left.description: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected recurrence_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

right.name: recurrence_t_category
right.description: The code to represent the extent of the primary tumour (T) based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected recurrence_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

left.name: recurrence_n_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by which is the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected recurrence_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

right.name: recurrence_n_category
right.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined by which is the extent of the regional lymph node (N) involvement for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected recurrence_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

left.name: recurrence_m_category
left.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined bythe extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected recurrence_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

right.name: recurrence_m_category
right.description: The code to represent the stage of cancer defined bythe extent of the distant metastasis (M) for the cancer based on evidence obtained from clinical assessment parameters determined determined at the time of retreatment for a recurrence or disease progression, according to criteria based on multiple editions of the AJCC's Cancer Staging Manual.

meta.notes: This field is required only if the selected recurrence_tumour_staging_system is any edition of the AJCC cancer staging system.

left.name: recurrence_stage_group
left.description: The code to represent the stage group of the tumour, as assigned by the reporting recurrence_tumour_staging_system, that indicates the overall prognostic tumour stage (ie. Stage I, Stage II, Stage III etc.) after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery.

right.name: recurrence_stage_group

meta.notes: This field is dependent on the selected recurrence_tumour_staging_system.

left.description: Specify the tumour staging system used to stage the cancer after treatment for patients receiving systemic and/or radiation therapy alone or as a component of their initial treatment, or as neoadjuvant therapy before planned surgery. right.name: primary_site
right.description: The text term used to describe the primary site of disease, as categorized by the World Health Organization's (WHO) International Classification of Diseases for Oncology (ICD-O). This categorization groups cases into general categories.

Bones, joints and articular cartilage of other and unspecified sites

Other and ill-defined sites within respiratory system and intrathoracic organs
Other and unspecified female genital organs
Other and unspecified major salivary glands
Other and unspecified male genital organs
Other and unspecified parts of biliary tract
Other and unspecified parts of mouth
Other and unspecified parts of tongue
Other endocrine glands and related structures
Peripheral nerves and autonomic nervous system
Spinal cord, cranial nerves, and other parts of central nervous system

right.name: drug_rxnormcui
right.description: The unique RxNormID assigned to the treatment regimen drug.

meta.notes:
This field uses standardized vocabulary from the RxNorm database (https://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/rxnorm), provided by the NIH.

You can search for RX Norm values through the web interface (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/) or API (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/download/rxnav/RxNormAPIs.html).

For example, to find the rxnormcui based on drug name, you can use: https://rxnav.nlm.nih.gov/REST/rxcui.json?name=leucovorin

meta.notes:
This field uses standardized vocabulary from the RxNorm database (https://www.nlm.nih.gov/research/umls/rxnorm), provided by the NIH.

You can search for RX Norm values through the web interface (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/RxNav/) or API (https://mor.nlm.nih.gov/download/rxnav/RxNormAPIs.html).

For example, to find the rxnormcui based on drug name, you can use: https://rxnav.nlm.nih.gov/REST/rxcui.json?name=leucovorin

data.name: drug_rxnormcui
data.description: The unique RxNormID assigned to the treatment regimen drug.
